kapi module¶

Transform function for Kapi DB

kapi.count_by_user(df_path, collection, user_edge_list='../files/user_edge_list_3.hdf5', user_post_dict='../files/group_post_by_user_in_post.hdf5', chunksize=10000000.0, save_path=None)[source]¶

Counter number of shares, comments or reactions by user

Parameters

  • df_path – path to concerned Pandas Dataframe

  • user_edge_list – str or DataFrame. if str, it should be available path

  • user_post_dict – str or dictionary

  • collections – str. one of ‘share’, ‘comment’ or ‘react’

Return type

python dictionary, (number of shares/comments/reacts by user_id)

kapi.count_by_user_comment(df_path, user_edge_list='../files/user_edge_list_3.hdf5', user_post_dict='../files/group_post_by_user_in_post.hdf5', chunksize=10000)[source]¶
kapi.count_by_user_react(df_path, user_edge_list='../files/user_edge_list_3.hdf5', user_post_dict='../files/group_post_by_user_in_post.hdf5', chunksize=10000000.0)[source]¶
kapi.count_by_user_share(df_path, user_edge_list='../files/user_edge_list_3.hdf5', user_post_dict='../files/group_post_by_user_in_post.hdf5', chunksize=10000)[source]¶
kapi.generate_data_torchgeo(edge_list='/tf/data/adv/node_embedding/release_v20/graph_data/user_edge_list_3.hdf5', node_atts='/tf/data/adv/node_embedding/release_v20/graph_data/node_atts_3.hdf5', edge_atts='/tf/data/adv/node_embedding/release_v20/graph_data/edge_feature_3.hdf5', reindex=True, save_path=None)[source]¶

Generate torch-geometric Data type

Parameters

  • edge_list – python dict or str.

  • node_atts – python dict or str.

  • edge_atts – python dict or str.

  • reindex – bool. If True, re-index all nodes start from 0

  • save_path –

— :rtype:

torch_geometric.data.Data python dictionary (re-indexing)

kapi.generate_edge_attribute(edge_list=['../files/edge_share_3.hdf5', '../files/edge_comment_3.hdf5', '../files/edge_react_3.hdf5'], save_path=None)[source]¶

Generate edge attribute from list of edges

Parameters

  • edge_list – [str] or [dictionary]. List of edge attribute count

  • save_path – str or None.

Return type

python dictionary (feature edge dictionary)

kapi.generate_edge_list(user_post_dict='../files/group_post_by_user_in_post.hdf5', share_dict='../files/group_user_by_post_in_share.hdf5', comment_dict='../files/group_user_by_post_in_comment.hdf5', react_dict='../files/group_user_by_post_in_reaction.hdf5', save_path=None)[source]¶

Generate edge list dictionary from dedicated dictionary of user_id - post_ids, and post_id - user_ids who share, comment and react

Parameters

  • user_post_dict – str or python dict, user_id - post_ids dict. If str, it should be available path

  • share_dict – user_id - post_ids who share

  • comment_dict – user_id - post_ids who comment

  • react_dict – user_id - post_ids who react

  • save_path – str. If None, save process is skipped

Return type

python dictionary (user_edge_list)

kapi.generate_node_attribute(user_edge_list='../files/user_edge_list_3.hdf5', df_user='../files/chosen_users.csv', attrs=['total_follower', 'total_friend', 'books_count', 'films_count', 'music_count', 'restaurants_count', 'sex'], save_path=None)[source]¶

Generate node attributes by given list

Parameters

  • user_edge_list – str or dict python. If str, it should be path

  • df_user – str or DataFrame, user dataframe

  • attrs – list, name of concerned attributes from df_user

  • save_path – str or None. If None, save process is skipped

Return type

python dictionary (node_atts_list: dict, key is node_id, values is array of concerned attributes)

kapi.group_post_by_user(df_post='../files/chosen_post_2.csv', save_path=None)[source]¶

Read post.csv collection and return dictionary of user_id - post_ids

Parameters

  • df_post – str or Pandas Dataframe. If str, df_post should be path to csv file

  • save_path – path to save. If None, save process is skipped

Return type

python dictionary (user_post_dict: dictionary of user_id - post_ids)

kapi.group_user_by_post(df_path, df_post, collection, save_path=None)[source]¶

Read df.csv collection and return dictionary of post_id - user_ids

Parameters

  • df_path – str. Path to DataFrame need to query (share, comment or react), df_path should be path to csv file

  • df_post – str or Pandas Dataframe. DataFrame of chosen post. If str, df should be path to csv file

  • collection – str, collection should be one of ‘share’, ‘comment’ or ‘reaction’

  • save_path – path to save. If None, save process is skipped

Return type

python dictionary
